skills: Differentiated Instruction, Multiple Intelligences, STEM Education, Problem-Based Learning, Common Core, NGSS, Sheltered Instruction Techniques, IEP/504 Plan Modification, Google Applications Training, Lesson Plan Development, Lab Design, Assessment, Fundraising, Professional Development, Google Certified Educator (Level 1), Constructive Criticism, Formative Assessment, Summative Assessment, Pathology Resident Training, Molecular Diagnostic Procedures, Laboratory Test Validation, Sample Concentration, Detection Limits, Instrument/Equipment Maintenance & Calibration, QC, DNA Extraction/Quantitation, PCR, CE, Molecular Studies Interpretation & Reporting, QA/QC Procedure and Protocol, Seminar Coordination, Technician Training, State Reporting, Specimen Troubleshooting, Technician Competency Assessment (TCA), Continuing Education (TCE) Programs, Patient Requisition Verification, Electrophoresis Testing.
work_experience: A highly experienced professional with a dual background in biology education and clinical laboratory operations, spanning from January 2005 to the present. As a Biology Teacher (11/2016-Current & 09/2011-11/2016), responsibilities included executing and modifying lesson plans with differentiated instruction, designing STEM-focused lessons and labs, co-teaching with special education teachers, providing Google applications training, fundraising for classroom technologies, and achieving Level 1 Google Certified Educator status. Earlier, served as a Clinical Lab Manager/Technologist (04/2007-04/2011), educating Pathology Residents, validating new laboratory tests, performing DNA extraction, PCR, CE, and managing laboratory equipment according to QA/QC protocols. Also worked as a Quality Control Technician - TCA/E Coordinator (08/2005-04/2007), coordinating seminars, managing technician competency assessments, and compiling state reports, and as a Clinical Laboratory Technician (01/2005-08/2005).
